label: Jane Morison's Petition Letter for the St. Andrew's Society
description: A letter from a woman petitioning the St. Andrew's Society for a renewal of financial aid based on her husband's death and being left with an infant child. The letter states that the woman is able to provide for herself and child partly on her own through working.

metadata.label: Description
metadata.value: A letter from a woman petitioning the St. Andrew's Society for a renewal of financial aid based on her husband's death and being left with an infant child. The letter states that the woman is able to provide for herself and child partly on her own through working.

metadata.label: Access Note
metadata.value: For more information contact Special Collections at Addlestone Library, College of Charleston, Charleston, SC, 29424.

metadata.label: Digitization Specifications
metadata.value: 600 dpi, 24-bit depth, color, Epson Expression 10000XL, Archival masters are tiffs.

metadata.label: Transcript
metadata.value:
[Top left corner] with papers of 1754

To the President, Vice President and Members of the St. Andrew's Club.

The petition of Jane Morison Widow 
Humbly Sheweth

That your petitioner's husband died near two years ago leaving your petitioner and an infant child without an means wherewithall [sic] to support either except your petitioner's own industry and labor.  That if it had not been for the relief given her by the worthy members of the Club last year, your petitioner would have been in a deplorable condition for which she takes this opportunity of [?]urning her grateful charity.

Your petitioner again prays that out of your wonled[?] bounty  charity you will be pleased to grant her some relief for herself and infant child and your petitioner as in duty bound shall pray obt [obediently]. 

             her
Jane [petitioner's mark] Morison 
 			mark.

metadata.label: Collection Title
metadata.value: St. Andrew's Society of Charleston Records, 1729-2001
